result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Attorney Lim requests another status hearing.  The Court will set a plea/sent and JT date.  Bond Continues. The Court notes there is no victim present that wishes to make a statement.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2023 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for February 14, 2023 at 08:30 am.
Signature Date:  07-20-2022

POSS METH/POSS DRUG NARC/POSS DRUG PARA: CONDITIONS: No contact with Keegan Stumpner, Alaina Lokken, Kodi Whitt.  Absolute sobriety.  No possession or consumption of controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription.  Comply with the Drug Free 24/7 Program. If you violate the rules of 24/7, your bond is immediately revoked and you will be jailed until such time as you can be brought before the court for a bond review hearing.

Defendant CALVIN D. SCHMIDT in court with attorney Michael Lim.  Defendant CALVIN D. SCHMIDT in custody.  Tucker T. Tellefson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim rights complied with.  Reading waived.  Defense motions for bond modification. State objects. Court orders $500 cash bond with 24/7 drug with all remaining conditions.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Arraignment on July 18, 2022 at 08:30 am.
